intro: Mimosa piptoptera, commonly known as the sensitive plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves that fold shut when touched. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rapid leaf movement in response to stimuli makes it a popular subject in botanical studies.
